tasks.task: Cultivate rice on mountain slopes in upland areas of Laos
subtasks: Clear land using slash and burn methods
Manage slopes to prevent soil erosion
Plant rice in valleys and on terraces
Grow other crops such as maize, job's tear, small grain legumes, pepper, sesame, vegetables, and fruits
Use leguminous plants like pigeon pea to improve soil productivity
Control weeds, including Imperata, using validated methods
Participate in farmer participatory research to select and test rice varieties
Implement improved crop management techniques, such as seed selection and testing germination
Reduce shifting cultivation cycle and dependence on slash and burn
Practice zero tillage or minimum tillage methods
Increase rice productivity to reduce pressure on steeply sloping fields
Protect the environment from deforestation and soil erosion
Enhance household food security
Apply technologies for environmental protection and improved agriculture

tasks.task: Collaborate with research institutions and extension agencies
subtasks: Participate in training activities and study tours
Distribute seed of improved and traditional rice varieties
Establish partnerships for regional collaboration
Use high-yielding rice varieties suited to local conditions
Apply traditional farming techniques that have been validated
Integrate leguminous crops into farming systems

tasks.task: Promote sustainable agriculture and forest management
subtasks: Reduce reliance on shifting cultivation
Manage land to improve soil fertility
Minimize insect pest incidence
Limit the use of slash and burn methods as per government policy

tasks.task: Cultivate rice on mountain slopes. The subtasks would be clearing land with slash and burn, managing the slopes, planting in valleys and terraces, maybe terrace construction? Not explicitly mentioned but implied. Then growing other crops. Use leguminous plants—like planting pigeon peas and managing them. Controlling weeds like Imperata. Testing and selecting rice varieties. Applying improved crop management techniques. And perhaps promoting zero-till methods.

Another MAINTASK could be Addressing agricultural constraints. So, increasing productivity, protecting the environment, reducing shifting cultivation. Those are more policy/aim-based, but in terms of tasks, farmers would be implementing these practices. Like not using slash and burn anymore due to policy, so they have to find alternatives.
Another MAINTASK could be Promote crop diversity. The transcript mentions growing other crops besides rice. So managing different crops, planting seeds, harvesting.

engage in small-scale agroforestry and livestock farming. Subtasks include raising livestock (like chickens, maybe pigs?), managing forests, collecting mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and medicinal plants. Sale of these products provides cash income.
